lines.text: [Michael Collins arrives at the ceremony to take down the British flag]
You're seven minutes late, Mr. Collins.
You've kept us waiting 700 years. You can have your seven minutes.
I hate them for making hate necessary, and I'll do what I can to end it.
The Minister is as usual exceeding his brief!
And what is my brief, Cathal?
Intelligence.
Bullshit! I'm Minister for Gun-Running, Daylight Robbery, and General Mayhem.
Is it true, Mick, that all of the women in America wear trousers?
Absolutely! Shameless hussies, the lot o' them.
There was a man in west Cork who proposed to five sisters.
I suppose they all refused.
Then the father died and he proposed to the mother.
Are you trying to tell me something?
I was working up to a proposal.
What happens next time?
Next time, Harry, we won't play by their rules. We'll invent our own!
The Irish people established the Irish Republic. It can only be disestablished by the Irish people.
I want peace and quiet. I want it so much I'd die for it.
Give *us* the future, we've had enough of your past. Give us back our country, to live in , to grow in, to love.
[as the British flag comes down]
So that's what all the bother was about.
I can't understand your politics, but I appreciate your integrity.
The problem with the Irish is that they'll sing at the drop of a hat, but ask them to talk and they won't.
You know what he'd say if he saw you right now, Kitty? Get up off the parliamentary side of your ass and put a bit of color in your face.
If they shut me up, who will take my place?
[first lines]

[dictating a letter]
You've got to think of him the way he was... He was what the times demanded. And life without him seems impossible. But he's dead. And life is possible. He made it possible.

[running away from the police while disguised as a prostitute]
All I'm missing is the high heels!
[repeated line]
Jesus Christ, Mick, where the hell have you been?
we can ignore them.
We have a weapon more powerful... than any in the whole arsenal of the British Empire! That weapon... is our refusal!

Make me a scapegoat if you will, call me a traitor, if you will; But please, let's save the country. The alternative to this treaty is a war which no one in this room can even contemplate. If the price of peace, if the price of freedom is the blackening of my name, I would gladly pay it.
So which one of you gunslingers is going to ask me to dance?
[Collins and his men have just intercepted an intelligence report from the Royal Irish Constabulary]
Jesus, these bastards know more about us than our own mothers.
They call us murderers.
War *is* murder! Sheer, bloody murder! Had you been here the past year, you'd know that!
Once I start, they'll be no stopping me.
Sufficient unto the day the evil thereof, hey boy?
Yes, sir.
Or is it Broy?
Broy, sir. Good night, sir.

[when he was arrested]
Let me go! I know exactly where I'm going. I can walk. I can walk.
Oh, did you hear there's a butterfly been seen in West Clair? Its wings are green, white, and yellow.
Oh, God!
The lads say it's a sign.
Sign? My... fuck it!
I'm tellin' ya.
You know the problem with butterflies?
What's that?
They only last one day.
Aye, but what a day, Mick!
